editionStmt.p: The initial version of this file was created from data kindly provided by the Ethiopic Manuscript Imaging Project directed by Steve Delamarter.

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens und Eritreas: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / Beta maṣāḥǝft

licence.p: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msContents.summary: F-45r: The Seven Covenants, ሰባቱ ኪዳናት, beginning with (f-13v) Morning Prayer Kidan za-nagh, ኪዳን፡ ዘነግህ፡. F-23v: Mystagogia, ትምሕርተ ኅቡአት. F-29v: On Peaceful Holy Things. In this section the king and the popes are mentioned only as ጳጳስነ አባ እገሌ and ንጉሥነ እገሌ, "Our father so-and-so, and Our King so-and-so." F-31r: Hymn, “Lift Up Your Heart to the Heavens,” በሰማይ የሀሉ ልብክሙ. F: Hymn during communion, “Holy, Holy, Holy, the Triune,” ቅዱስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ሥሉስ፡. F-36r: Prayer, “God of the luminaries,” እግዚአብሔር ዘብራሃናት. MG 38ff; MQ 199 –200; Liturgy 244 –5; Sebastian Euringer, “Die äthiopische Anaphora des hl. Epiphanius Bischofs der Insel Cypern,” OC, third series, 1 (1926) 126 –8. EMIP 37, f –117v. F-45r: Hymn to God, “We Thank you, O Holy God,” ነአኵተከ አምላክ ቅዱስ. F-60r: [Mystery of] the resurrection of the dead, Mǝ śṭir Tǝnśa’e Mutan, ምሥጢረ፡ ትንሣኤ፡ ሙታን፡, in Amharic ( is misplaced). Ff. 60rv: Asmat prayer against snake, ጸሎተ: ዓርዌ: ምድር፡, incomplete at the end. and 61r(misplaced folios) Excerpt of the Image of Saint George. F-62r: Unidentifed excerpt from prayer. has a note of ownership in which the orignal name has been erased and another, ፈትለ ሥላሲ, has been inserted. The same thing happens on . The book seems composite, with the first 45 folios written in a 17th or 18th century hand, and the later folios written in a 19th century hand.
